info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT... SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND SOUTHWESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Melrose, or 27 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Melrose, Ragland, Mcalister, and Forrest. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 351 and 365. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.
